change.item: This finding aid was updated in alignment with LC EAD 2.0 specifications using a python script created by Erik Radio.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Photocopy of manuscript accompanied by a typed transcription. Autobiographical account of the homesteading experiences of the Roberts family: Sarah, her physician husband, and their three sons, Frank, Lathrop, and Brockway. It begins in western Canada in 1906, and ends when they return to the United States in 1911.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Canadian History (MS 107). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Pioneer near Stettler, Alberta, Canada from 1906-1911.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of manuscript accompanied by a typed transcription. Autobiographical account of the homesteading experiences of the Roberts family: Sarah, her physician husband, and their three sons, Frank, Lathrop, and Brockway. It begins in western Canada in 1906, and ends when they return to the United States in 1911.

relatedmaterial.p: Sarah Ellen Roberts' manuscript was later edited by her son, Lathrop E. Roberts and published in 1968, with the title Of Us and the Oxen, by Modern Press, Saskatoon, Sask. In 1971, it was republished by the University of Texas, and retitled Alberta Homestead: Chronicle of a Pioneer Family.
